channel.title: Open-iot-challenge-entries on Eclipse IoT
channel.description: Recent content in Open-iot-challenge-entries on Eclipse IoT

item.title: A React component for getting YouTube videos using voice
item.description: A week ago, we have introduced our new project “Alya” in participation for Eclipse Open IoT Challenge , “Alya” is a modular personalized open-source smart mirror. In this blog, I am excited to talk about one of the core addons…

item.title: Trusted IoT - Graba: A BLE Beacons Recording System
item.description: Grabar is the Spanish word of the verb “to record”. The translation of graba in English is “it records“. Graba is part of Jura and its function is to record datasets. It consists of two Kura’s plug-ins: iot.challenge.jura.graba and iot.challenge.jura.graba.web.

item.title: “alya” a DIY modular personalized open-source smart mirror
item.description: Two months has passed since the eclipse open IoT challenge 4.0 started, and in this first blog we are so excited to talk about our idea “alya-smart-mirror”.

item.title: Activ-IoTy Checkpoint: UHF RFID + RPi + Paho for Python
item.description: One of the most important pieces of Activ-IoTy is Checkpoints. This article features the implementation of a checkpoint based on a IND903 UHF RFID Reader, connected to a Raspberry Pi (or a Intel Up Squared).

item.title: Trusted IoT - Faro: A Multimodal BLE Beacon
item.description: Faro is the Spanish term for a lighthouse, as well as a multimodal Bluetooth Low Energy Beacon service for Eclipse Kura.

item.title: Trusted IoT - Building Deployment Packages for Eclipse Kura
item.description: OSGi is ideal for managing IoT gateways and we believe that it is a wise move that Eclipse Kura has been developed using it.

item.title: Activ-IoTy - new Video
item.description: High level explanation of the objectives of Activ-IoTy, a personal project being developed for the Open IoT Challenge.

item.title: Activ-IoTy - MQTT: Cornerstone of Activ-IoTy
item.description: Activ-IoTy is based on the pub-sub paradigm. This means that some components (publishers or senders) send messages to a central point, called broker, that delivers the messages to other components (subscribers or receivers) interested in receiving the information send by the publishers…

item.title: Trusted IoT - Preliminary results
item.description: This has been a great week for us :). Our team consists of three computer engineers; all of us from different fields, with great interest and curiosity about IoT but inexperienced in it.

item.title: CISSOS - Getting started with the Open IoT Challenge!
item.description: Two months have passed since we handed in our topic for the Open IoT Challenge and now we (finally!) want to give an introduction to our project and what we want to (and have already) achieve(d).

item.title: Protocol Layers of Activ-IoTy
item.description: ActivIoTy is based on recognized standard protocols. Since the platform is designed to allow different and heterogeneous devices and implementations, standard technologies are crucial for scalability, enhancement of the system, and also to preserve integrity of data.

item.title: Trync - Setup development environment for ESP32 - Part 2
item.description: In the first part we have already setup and configured ESP-IDF. So let’s do the code, compile and flash with an IDE. I have choose Eclipse IDE which is my favorite for a long time for Java, Atmel AVR and now ESP32 developments.

item.title: Activ-IoTy Components
item.description: Checkpoints and Controller: these are the main pieces of ActivIoTy.

item.title: Trync - Setup development environment for ESP32 - Part 1
item.description: For Trync hardware development the key component (Trync agent or Trync-a in short) is ESP32 SoC microcontroller by Espressif.

item.title: Hardware solutions for Eclipse IOT Challenge: Exploring LoRa/LoRaWAN
item.description: The Open IoT challenge lead me to research more in depth different technologies both from the hardware and the software aspect.
